org.jcvi.jillion.core

Class Ranges

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.Ranges

  • public final class Ranges
extends Object
    Ranges is a helper class for operating on a collection of Range objects.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        public static List<Range> merge(Collection<Range> rangesToMerge)
        Combine the given Ranges into fewer ranges that cover the same region. This is the same as merge(rangesToMerge,0)
        Parameters:
        rangesToMerge - the collection of Ranges to merge;
        Returns:
        a new list of merged Ranges.
        See Also:
        merge(Collection, int)

      • merge

        public static List<Range> merge(Collection<Range> rangesToMerge,
                                int maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges)
        Combine the given Ranges into fewer ranges that cover the same region. For example 2 ranges [0-2] and [1-4] could be merged into a single range [0-4].
        Parameters:
        rangesToMerge - the ranges to be merged together.
        maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges - the maximum distance between the end of one range and the start of another in order to be merged.
        Returns:
        a new list of merged Ranges.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges < 0.

      • asRanges

        public static List<Range> asRanges(BitSet bits)
        Convert all the set bits in the given BitSet into contiguous ranges. For example if there are set bits at offsets 0,1,2 and 4,5 then the Ranges [0-2] and [4-5] will be returned.
        API Note:
        This is the same as asRanges(bits, 0).
        Parameters:
        bits - the BitSet to convert into Ranges; can not be null but may have no bits set.
        Returns:
        a new list of Ranges; will never be null but may be empty.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bits is null
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        asRanges(BitSet, int)

      • asRanges

        public static List<Range> asRanges(BitSet bits,
                                   int maxDistance)
        Convert all the set bits in the given BitSet into contiguous ranges. For example if there are set bits at offsets 0,1,2 and 4,5 then:
        1. if maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges <2, then the Ranges [0-2] and [4-5] will be returned
        2. if maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges >=2 then one Range [0-5] is returned
        Parameters:
        bits - the BitSet to convert into Ranges; can not be null but may have no bits set.
        maxDistance - the maximum distance between the end of one range and the start of another in order to be merged.
        Returns:
        a new list of Ranges; will never be null but may be empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxDistance < 0.
        NullPointerException - if bits is null
        Since:
        5.3

      • asRanges

        public static List<Range> asRanges(int[] sortedOffsets)
        Convert all offsets in the sorted array into contiguous ranges. For example if the array is {0,1,2,4,5} then the Ranges [0-2] and [4-5] will be returned.
        API Note:
        This is the same as asRanges(sortedOffsets, 0).
        Parameters:
        sortedOffsets - the array of SORTED values to convert into Ranges; can not be null but may be empty. The array must be sorted from smallest to largest.
        Returns:
        a new list of Ranges; will never be null but may be empty.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bits is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if sortedOffsets is not sorted from smallest to largest.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        asRanges(int[], int)

      • asRanges

        public static List<Range> asRanges(int[] sortedOffsets,
                                   int maxDistance)
        Convert all offsets in the sorted array into contiguous ranges. For example if the array is {0,1,2,4,5} then:
        1. if maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges <2, then the Ranges [0-2] and [4-5] will be returned
        2. if maxDistanceBetweenAdjacentRanges >=2 then one Range [0-5] is returned
        Parameters:
        sortedOffsets - the array of SORTED values to convert into Ranges; can not be null but may be empty. The array must be sorted from smallest to largest.
        maxDistance - the maximum distance between the end of one range and the start of another in order to be merged.
        Returns:
        a new list of Ranges; will never be null but may be empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxDistance < 0.
        NullPointerException - if array is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if sortedOffsets is not sorted from smallest to largest.
        Since:
        5.3

      • mergeIntoClusters

        public static List<Range> mergeIntoClusters(Collection<Range> rangesToMerge,
                                            int maxClusterDistance)
        Combine the given Ranges into fewer ranges that cover the same region. For example 2 ranges [0-2] and [1-4] could be merged into a single range [0-4].
        Parameters:
        rangesToMerge - the ranges to be merged together.
        maxClusterDistance - the maximum distance between the end of one range and the start of another in order to be merged.
        Returns:
        a new list of merged Ranges.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if clusterDistance < 0.

      • createInclusiveRange

        public static Range createInclusiveRange(Collection<Range> ranges)
        Return a single Range that covers the entire span of the given Ranges.

        For example: passing in 2 Ranges [0,10] and [20,30] will return [0,30]

        Parameters:
        ranges - a collection of ranges
        Returns:
        a new Range that covers the entire span of input ranges.

      • createInclusiveRange

        public static <T> Range createInclusiveRange(Collection<T> collection,
                                             Function<T,Range> mapper)
        Return a single Range that covers the entire span of the given Ranges.

        For example: passing in 2 Ranges [0,10] and [20,30] will return [0,30]

        Parameters:
        ranges - a collection of ranges
        Returns:
        a new Range that covers the entire span of input ranges.

      • intersects

        public static boolean intersects(Collection<Range> ranges,
                                 Range target)
        Check if the target Range intersects any range in the given list.
        API Note:
        this is the same as: 
         for(Range r : ranges){
     if(r.intersects(target)){
         return true;
     }
 }
 return false;
        Parameters:
        ranges - the list of Ranges to check; can not be null but may be empty.
        target - the intersection target Range.
        Returns:
        true if the target intersects any Range; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any paramter is null or any Range in the given list is null.
        Since:
        5.3

      • intersects

        public static <T> boolean intersects(Collection<T> ts,
                                     Function<T,Range> mapper,
                                     Range target)
        Check if the target Range intersects any range in the given list.
        Parameters:
        ts - the collection of objects to check; can not be null but may be empty.
        mapper - the Mapper function to convert the type in the input collection into a Range. if the mapper returns a null Range, then that element is skipped.
        target - the intersection target Range.
        Returns:
        true if the target intersects any Range; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any paramter is null or any Range in the given list is null.
        Since:
        5.3
